intro: Sonchus marginatus, commonly known as the Margined Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright stems and alternate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, surrounded by leaf-like bracts. Its leaves are hairy and often have a distinctive white margin, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain regions.
